headline: Iran's crackdown reaches unprecedented levels: 'There were layers of bodies stacked on top of each other'
description: Point-blank shootings at protests, hangars filled with corpses and omnipresent security forces: Multiple accounts gathered by Le Monde attest to the unparalleled violence used by authorities to suppress the demonstrations.

headline: Denmark announces boosted military presence in Greenland 'from today'
US suspends immigrant visa procedures for nationals of 75 countries
2025 ranks among the three hottest years ever recorded
description: For the first time, a three-year period – from 2023 to 2025 – has surpassed the symbolic threshold of 1.5°C of warming, the most ambitious limit set by the Paris Agreement, according to the European climate observatory Copernicus.

headline: Russia steps up Ukraine strikes as polar cold grips the country
description: Russian air strikes on Ukrainian power infrastructure aim to trigger a humanitarian crisis as the population faces an unusual cold snap, with temperatures dropping as low as -20°C.

headline: Chiara Ferragni acquitted in charity cake and Easter egg fraud trial
description: A major fashion influencer, with 28 million followers, Chiara Ferragni had been accused of misleading consumers and illicitly profiting from sales of pandoro Christmas cakes that purported to raise money for charity.

headline: After celebrating Maduro ouster, Venezuelan migrants in US fear what lies ahead
description: After celebrating the abduction of Nicolas Maduro, Venezuelan asylum seekers in the US have begun to have doubts. In Denver, Colorado, where they number in the tens of thousands, many now fear having to go back to their country with the Chavistas still in power.

headline: Author Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie denounces Nigerian healthcare after baby son's death
Louvre's higher ticket prices for non-European visitors take effect
Corsican nationalist's assassination questions 'myth' of criminal code of honor
Marine Le Pen changes her defense strategy in appeal trial
Taxing the ultra-rich returns to France's budget debate
EU says Ukraine will spend most of €90 billion loan on military needs
France records more deaths than births in 2025, a first since World War II
France bans far-right British activists from entering its territory
'Corporate America is crushing the planet with its profits'
France will inaugurate Greenland consulate in February
Thailand train accident caused by crane collapse kills at least 32
'Nobel Prize for Environment' awarded to specialist in invisible, fascinating and vital mycorrhizal fungi
Long before coveting Greenland, the US expanded by opening its checkbook
description: From the early 19th century on, the United States expanded by acquiring territory through purchase or force. By expressing interest in Greenland, Donald Trump has revived that tradition.

headline: 'The Islamic Republic of Iran is entering its final phase'
description: Hemmed in by domestic and external crises, the Islamic Republic of Iran is now finding itself with nowhere left to turn, analyzes Farid Vahid, the co-director of the Observatory of North Africa and the Middle East at the Fondation Jean Jaurès.

headline: Paris launches project for Montparnasse renovation
description: The architect Renzo Piano unveiled his new renovation plan for the shopping center. Construction is hoped to start in 2028.

headline: Trump's disastrous undermining of the Federal Reserve
'The raw and brutal display of American power in the Trump II era is finally opening the eyes of Washington's allies'
'The trial of Marine Le Pen exposes the fragility of the concept of the rule of law'
